spec.scope: Standardisation of textual syntax for RDF

info.p: Turtle is a new specification, which is in development since 2011 within the W3C. Currently, it has a W3C Working Draft status. The specification defines the syntax for RDF and allows to describe an RDF graph in a compact textual form. Turtle is a subset of Notation 3 (N3). However, it is not so powerful like N-3 and can only serialize valid RDF graphs. Turtle is easy to develop and is an alternative to other variety of syntaxes/serialization formats for RDF.
Turtle Grammar is a subset of the SPARQL Query Language for RDF.
